item.title: Expert 3: International Trade Expert (Category 1)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Enhancing Trade and Business Opportunities in Mozambique in the Framework of the SADC EPA Implementation

Expert 3: International Trade Expert (Category 1)

This expert will focus mainly on the trade facilitation aspects i.e. completing the terms of reference for the category C of the WTO Trade Facilitation Agreement provisions.

The following eligibility requirements should be met:

  • Relevant professional qualifications at least Masters Degree or, in its absence equivalent professional experience in economics, international trade, business administration or other relevant topic
  • At least 12 years international expertise in trade issues in developing countries particularly with regard to trade facilitation, at least 4 of those preferably in Southern Africa
  • Knowledge of the requested areas is preferred, this refers specifically to the following areas:
  • Creation of Enquiry Points for Trade Facilitation (provision 1.3)
  • Definition of Structures and Procedures for Consultations between Border Agencies in the Scope of Trade Facilitation (provision 2.2)
  • Advance Rulings (provision 3)
  • Review of the Fees and Charges Imposed on the Import and Export of Goods, and Assessment of their Compliance with Provisions 6.1 and 6.2 of the Agreement on Trade Facilitation
  • Expedited Shipments (provision 7.8)
  • Definition of Options and Institutional Change Plan for Border Agency Cooperation (provision 8)
  • Single Window (provision 10.4)
  • Pre-shipment Inspection (provision 10.5)
  • Experience from similar assignments
  • Good communicator, excellent drafting and planning skills
  • Excellent English writing skills

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

*WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS *

item.title: Expert 2: Policy Analyst (Category 2)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Enhancing Trade and Business Opportunities in Mozambique in the Framework of the SADC EPA Implementation

Mozambique is part of the six Southern African Development Community (SADC) countries that signed an Economic Partnership Agreement (EPA) with the European Union on 10 June 2016. The SADC EPA Group comprises Botswana, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa and Swaziland.

The purpose of the present assignment is to define a national EPA Implementation Plan that includes relevant actions/measures to be implemented to facilitate the EPA and to facilitate stakeholders to benefit from the EPA. Furthermore, the consultants shall to also identify the most relevant areas where potential technical assistance is required.

Expert 2: Policy Analyst (Category 2)

  • Relevant professional qualifications in economics, business administration or other relevant topic, or in its absence, equivalent professional experience
  • At least 6 years of in-depth expertise in business, international trade agreements and investment in Southern Africa (business development services, international trade agreements, policy formulation and capacity building)
  • Demonstrated knowledge of international trade agreements is required; in addition knowledge of the Economic Partnership Agreement is highly preferred in SADC, or alternatively other region
  • Proven statistical analysis, experience and capacity
  • Knowledge of the Mozambican legal and regulatory framework would be an advantage
  • Demonstrated ability to collect, analyse and synthesize economic data to produce evidence based recommendations to public and private institutions
  • Effective communication and reporting skills
  • Knowledge of Portuguese would be highly appreciated

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

*WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS *

item.title: Senior Expert in Business, Trade and Investment (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Enhancing Trade and Business Opportunities in Mozambique in the Framework of the SADC EPA Implementation

Mozambique is part of the six Southern African Development Community (SADC) countries that signed an Economic Partnership Agreement (EPA) with the European Union on 10 June 2016. The SADC EPA Group comprises Botswana, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa and Swaziland.

The purpose of the present assignment is to define a national EPA Implementation Plan that includes relevant actions/measures to be implemented to facilitate the EPA and to facilitate stakeholders to benefit from the EPA. Furthermore, the consultants shall to also identify the most relevant areas where potential technical assistance is required.

Senior Expert in Business, Trade and Investment (TL) (Category 1)

Relevant professional qualifications :

  • at least Masterâ€™s Degree or, in its absence equivalent professional experience in economics, international trade, business administration or other relevant topic
  • At least 12 years international expertise in business, trade and investment in developing countries (trade agreements, trade policy, enterprise competitiveness policies, strategies and initiatives).
  • Demonstrated knowledge and competency in private sector development such as promoting trade and sustainable economic development, building institutional capacity of business support organizations, promoting business development, etc.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of international trade agreements is required; in addition knowledge of the Economic Partnership Agreement is highly preferred in SADC, or alternatively other region
  • Demonstrable research and analytical skills
  • Experience from similar assignments
  • Good communicator, experienced leader and moderator
  • Excellent English writing skills

item.title: Junior Expert in Sustainable Energy
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation of the programme ‘Support to the introduction of Sustainable Development Policies - Rationale use of Natural Resources in the Energy-Environment Sectors in Turkmenistan

Overall objective: to improve natural resources management and contribute to the sustainable development of Turkmenistan, in line with its long-term economic growth objectives.

Specific objective: to set-up the first steps necessary to understand the overall rationale of sustainable development policies and to support the development and the implementation of policy, regulatory, and institutional frameworks in the energy and environment sectors.

Junior Expert in Sustainable Energy

It is expected that an expert of category Junior (Category III) will be appointed to support the Senior Expert with this assignment.

The Junior Expert must possess the following qualifications and skills:

  • Education to at least Master Degree level or alternatively professional experience of minimum 5 years relevant to the energy field;
  • At least 3 years of professional experience relevant to the legislative and/or institutional and/or policy development of sustainable energy;
  • Excellent verbal and written skills in the following language(s): Turkmen and/or Russian, English;
  • Local expertise i.e. experience in Turkmenistan and/or Central Asia;
  • Experience with evaluation methods and techniques in general is an advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Expert in Environment/Energy (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation of the programme ‘Support to the introduction of Sustainable Development Policies - Rationale use of Natural Resources in the Energy-Environment Sectors in Turkmenistan

Overall objective: to improve natural resources management and contribute to the sustainable development of Turkmenistan, in line with its long-term economic growth objectives.

Specific objective: to set-up the first steps necessary to understand the overall rationale of sustainable development policies and to support the development and the implementation of policy, regulatory, and institutional frameworks in the energy and environment sectors.

Senior Expert in Environment/Energy (TL)

The Team Leader must possess the following qualifications and skills:

  • Education to at least Master Degree level, or alternatively relevant professional experience of a minimum 14 years;
  • At least 12 years of relevant professional experience relevant to the sustainable management and protection of natural resources;
  • Excellent verbal and written skills in the following language(s): English. * Working knowledge of Russian is preferred.

In addition, the Senior Expert will be expected to possess expertise in:

  • Evaluation methods and techniques in general and, if possible, of evaluation in the field of external relations and development cooperation;
  • At least 12 years of professional experience gained in the environment/energy sector. Knowledge of one or more of the following areas: Energy policy; legislative and institutional development of sustainable energy/renewable sources; technical assistance/international cooperation projects in the area of energy efficiency; demand-side management of energy efficiency.
  • Previous relevant experience in Turkmenistan and/or Central Asia is an advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

item.title: Environment Infrastructure Expert (cat. II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Self-evaluation of IPA I Environment Infrastructure Projects

The global objective of the evaluation is to provide the EUD to BiH with sufficient information to make an informed judgment about the past performance of the selected projects (their efficiency, effectiveness and impact), to document lessons learned and to provide practical recommendations for follow-up action.

Specific objectives;

  • To assess in particular the efficiency, effectiveness and impact of project implementation, indicating clearly to what extent the results, purposes and overall objectives of the selected projects were achieved.
  • To provide comparative assessment of efficiency, effectiveness and impact of EUD interventions based on the selected projects, including strengthens and weaknesses of the different implementation methods.
  • To identify and document lessons learned, focusing on the design, implementation and management of the selected projects for improving of programming and identification of possible future actions under IPA II.
  • To provide recommendations for practical follow-up action, with the emphasis on actions related to sustainability of project benefits.

The evaluation will determine to what extent the projects have collectively succeeded in meeting the objectives of the EU as set out in the relevant country strategy paper and to what extent the projects have increased the Governmentâ€™s ability to meet its objectives within the agreed framework of cooperation with the EU. It is therefore important that the review will focus not only on the individual projects being evaluated, but also on their overall achievements.

Environment Infrastructure Expert (cat. II)

Education

  • As a minimum Master Degree in Engineering disciplines relevant to the fields of this contract, or, in its absence, equivalent professional experience of at least 4 years above the general professional experience duration fixed below.

Experience General profession experience:

  • Minimum 6 years of general professional experience in the environment sector.

Specific professional experience:

  • As a minimum, this expert must have participated in 3 environment infrastructure programmes/projects funded by EU and/or other donors/IFIs.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of English, both spoken and written;
  • Knowledge of the local language (B/H/S) will be considered an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

*WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS *

item.author: Penny Buckle

Self-evaluation of IPA I Environment Infrastructure Projects

The global objective of the evaluation is to provide the EUD to BiH with sufficient information to make an informed judgment about the past performance of the selected projects (their efficiency, effectiveness and impact), to document lessons learned and to provide practical recommendations for follow-up action.

  • To provide comparative assessment of efficiency, effectiveness and impact of EUD interventions based on the selected projects, including strengthens and weaknesses of the different implementation methods.
  • To identify and document lessons learned, focusing on the design, implementation and management of the selected projects for improving of programming and identification of possible future actions under IPA II.
  • To provide recommendations for practical follow-up action, with the emphasis on actions related to sustainability of project benefits.

The evaluation will determine to what extent the projects have collectively succeeded in meeting the objectives of the EU as set out in the relevant country strategy paper and to what extent the projects have increased the Governmentâ€™s ability to meet its objectives within the agreed framework of cooperation with the EU. It is therefore important that the review will focus not only on the individual projects being evaluated, but also on their overall achievements.

Evaluation Expert (cat. I)

Education

  • As a minimum Master Degree in a discipline relevant to the fields of this assignment or, in its absence, equivalent professional experience of at least 4 years above the general professional experience duration fixed below.

Experience

General professional experience:

  • Minimum 12 years of general professional experience in working with EU and/or donors/IFIs funded projects.

Specific professional experience:

  • As a minimum, this expert must have participated in the position of project evaluator and/or project monitor in three evaluations and/or monitoring of projects completed in the past five years in the environment sector.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of English, both spoken and written;
  • Knowledge of the local language (B/H/S) will be considered an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

item.title: Expert on Social Cash Transfers (cat II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
‘Evaluate the Community Score Card methodology and success in 24 communities in Swaziland, to empower grassroot citizen to demand quality basic service’

The global objective of the assignment is:

  • to assess the relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, impact and sustainability of the project “Interact with Communities and Health Facilities to implement Community Score Card” implemented by World Vision-Swaziland, with technical assistance and capacity development specifically on the CSC methodology, delivered by COSPE-Italy;
  • to verify that the activities and results of the project are in line with those outlined in the Financing Agreement, and project documents annexed to the respective contracts.

Expert on Social Cash Transfers (cat II)

  • at least 6 yearsâ€™ experience in a social sector, with some of it related to poverty reduction and/or social transfers
  • a basic degree in a social sector and a Master Degree in a relevant sector, such as social protection, Social Science, economics, poverty related studies, social work, or related relevant studies. In absence of required diploma, equivalent professional experience with duration above 8 years must be demonstrated in the CV.
  • proven experience with poverty reduction programmes, and/or social transfer programmes, social welfare problematics, and/or targeting mechanisms for vulnerable groups, benefit delivery mechanisms, monitoring and database maintenance for social programmes,â€¦
  • knowledgeable about conditionalities in welfare programmes, co-responsibilities of beneficiaries, and how to monitor these.
  • proven experience with social cash transfer schemes in developing countries would be an advantage
  • proven experience in working with orphans and vulnerable children (OVC) in developing countries would be an advantage
  • experience in monitoring and/or evaluation of development projects, preferable in a developing country setting, would be an advantage
  • experience with EU methodology and regulations, EU monitoring and reporting practices would be an advantage.
  • computer literacy; excellent analytical, conceptual, communication and reporting skills
  • good teamwork ability and culturally sensitive
  • fluent in written and spoken English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Specialist in linking communities to Primary Health Care (cat II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluate the Community Score Card methodology and success in 24 communities in Swaziland, to empower grassroot citizen to demand quality basic service

The global objective of the assignment is:

  • to assess the relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, impact and sustainability of the project “Interact with Communities and Health Facilities to implement Community Score Card” implemented by World Vision-Swaziland, with technical assistance and capacity development specifically on the CSC methodology, delivered by COSPE-Italy;
  • to verify that the activities and results of the project are in line with those outlined in the Financing Agreement, and project documents annexed to the respective contracts.

Specialist in linking communities to Primary Health Care (cat II)

  • At least 6 yearsâ€™ experience in the health sector, preferable in basic health services, preferably in developing countries
  • At least a basic degree in the health sector and a Master Degree in a relevant sector. In absence of required diploma, equivalent professional experience with duration above 8 years must be demonstrated in the CV.
  • Experience with health systems in an African setting. Knowledgeable in Primary Health Care strengthening in a development setting (for example: the health pyramid, referral systems, basic health care packages, essential drugs management, hygiene and infection control in health facilities, retention of health care workers, quality of PHC).
  • Knowledgeable, through experience, of barriers to access to basic services, for disadvantaged communities, due to poverty, distance, cultural obstacles, etc.
  • Proven experience in monitoring and/or evaluation of health projects, preferable in a developing country setting.
  • Having knowledge of EU regulations and procedures in external development actions would be an advantage.
  • Computer literacy; excellent analytical, conceptual, communication and reporting skills
  • Good teamwork ability and culturally sensitive
  • Fluent in written and spoken English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

The global objective of the assignment is:

  • to assess the relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, impact and sustainability of the project “Interact with Communities and Health Facilities to implement Community Score Card” implemented by World Vision-Swaziland, with technical assistance and capacity development specifically on the CSC methodology, delivered by COSPE-Italy;
  • to verify that the activities and results of the project are in line with those outlined in the Financing Agreement, and project documents annexed to the respective contracts.

Community mobilisation specialist; project evaluation specialist (team leader; cat I)

  • At least 12 years' experience in the community mobilization and/or grass-root empowerment and/or participatory governance. The expert must have experience in project evaluation, preferably in developing countries.
  • At least a basic degree in the social sector, or governance and development or economics and a Master Degree in a relevant sector. In absence of required diploma, equivalent professional experience with duration above 14 years must be demonstrated in the CV.
  • Proven experience in monitoring and evaluation of development projects, preferably in developing countries
  • Experience with community mobilization, or participatory approaches, or grass-root empowerment, or linking rural populations with governance and service monitoring, preferably in developing countries.
  • Experience with community engagement techniques, such as Focus Group Discussions, Key Informant Interviews, and/or working with Local Authorities in rural settings.
  • Experience with Project Cycle Management: from implementation to M&E; the use of Logical Frameworks, the interpretation of indicators to follow progress, the methodology of output/outcome/impact monitoring
  • Experience with EU procedures in external actions (PRAG, finance and contracts issues, project cycle, monitoring EU projects preferably having knowledge the EU Results Oriented Monitoring methodology - ROM).
  • Computer literacy; excellent analytical, conceptual, communication and reporting skills
  • Good teamwork ability and culturally sensitive
  • Fluent in written and spoken English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: SME Development Specialist (Cat III)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Final Evaluation of IPA 2011 Grant Support for Local Economic Development

Global objective: To provide the Delegation of the European Union with systematic and timely evaluation of its programme to demonstrate accountability and to promote lesson learning to improve policy and practice.

Specific objective: The specific objective of the evaluation is to identify key lessons and to produce recommendations to improve current and inform of future choices on IPA II support to Bosnia and Herzegovina in the field of SME competitiveness and innovation at local level.

SME Development Specialist (Cat III)

Qualifications and skills

  • Education at least Master Degree in any field related to economic sciences, or in its absence, at least 3 years of relevant experience in the private sector development are required above the general professional experience required below.

General professional experience:

  • At least 3 years of relevant experience in the private sector development.

Specific professional experience:

  • As a minimum, this expert must have participated in one international aid project in the area of SME or local economy development completed in the past five years.
  • The expert should preferably demonstrate previous relevant expertise in the country/region.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of English, both spoken and written.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Evaluation Expert (Cat.II)

item.description:
Final Evaluation of IPA 2011 Grant Support for Local Economic Development

Global objective: To provide the Delegation of the European Union with systematic and timely evaluation of its programme to demonstrate accountability and to promote lesson learning to improve policy and practice.

Specific objective: The specific objective of the evaluation is to identify key lessons and to produce recommendations to improve current and inform of future choices on IPA II support to Bosnia and Herzegovina in the field of SME competitiveness and innovation at local level.

Evaluation Expert (Cat II)

Qualifications and skills

  • Education at least Masters Degree Academic level, or in its absence, at least 6 years of relevant experience in the private sector development are required above the general professional experience required below.

General professional experience:

  • At least 6 years of relevant experience in the private sector development.

Specific professional experience:

  • As a minimum, this expert must have participated in two reviews, and/or assessments, and/or monitoring, and/or evaluations of projects completed in the past five years.
  • At least 3 years of relevant experience in EU SME policy, preferably gained in implementation of the EU funded projects.
  • The expert should preferably demonstrate previous relevant expertise in the country/region.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of English, both spoken and written.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

item.title: Expert in IT Security
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Preparation of supply tender dossiers for Serbian Ministry of Interior (MUP)

Global objective

The overall objective of this assignment is to support Serbiaâ€™s commitment in meeting EU standards in the field of safety and security through implementation of Action Plan on Chapter 24 and Chapter 23.

Specific objective(s)

The specific objectives of this assignments is to provide preliminary assessments, market researches, preparation of technical specifications and tender dossiers and providing input during clarifications and in the tender evaluations for the following tender procedures:

  • Supply of ICT equipment, security equipment, software solutions and analytical tools for strengthening capacities within Home Affairs Sector for the fight against organized crime by implementation of: Intelligence Led Policing, National Criminal Intelligence System and Strengthening international police cooperation (in line with EUROPOL standards)
  • Supply of video, audio and IT equipment for strengthening capacity of Internal Control Unit to fight against corruption within the police

Expert 3 Expert in IT security - Category 2

Qualifications and skills:

  • University degree /Master Degree (where a university degree has been awarded on completion of four years study or equivalent institutions) in the field of engineering, information and technology or other field related to this contract
  • Fluency in English, both written and spoken

General professional experience:

  • At least 6 (six) years of working experience in the design and management of security and integration of ICT infrastructure.

Specific professional experience:

  • Minimum 3 years, preferably 5 years of experience in the area of Information System Security (as cryptography - symmetric and asymmetric, cryptographic technology and RFID technology); using of smart cards in design application and access control solutions, access control system implementation with business continuity aspects.
  • Experience in preparation of technical specifications and /or Terms of References for 1, preferably 2, IT projects.
  • Experience in at least 1 project in design/implementation of communications and security systems for law enforcement bodies ( police /prosecutor) is an asset

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Preparation of supply tender dossiers for Serbian Ministry of Interior (MUP)

Global objective

The overall objective of this assignment is to support Serbiaâ€™s commitment in meeting EU standards in the field of safety and security through implementation of Action Plan on Chapter 24 and Chapter 23.

Specific objective(s)

The specific objectives of this assignments is to provide preliminary assessments, market researches, preparation of technical specifications and tender dossiers and providing input during clarifications and in the tender evaluations for the following tender procedures:

  • Supply of ICT equipment, security equipment, software solutions and analytical tools for strengthening capacities within Home Affairs Sector for the fight against organized crime by implementation of: Intelligence Led Policing, National Criminal Intelligence System and Strengthening international police cooperation (in line with EUROPOL standards)
  • Supply of video, audio and IT equipment for strengthening capacity of Internal Control Unit to fight against corruption within the police

Expert 2 Expert in Information and Communication Technologies - Category 1

Qualifications and skills:

  • University degree /Master Degree (where a university degree has been awarded on completion of four years study or equivalent institutions) in the field of engineering, information and technology or other field related to this contract.

General professional experience:

  • At least twelve (12) years, preferably 15 years of working experience in the design of integrated ICT and networking systems on multi-vendor platform
  • Fluency in English, both written and spoken

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 1, preferably 2 projects in consulting experience with public sector organizations in the area of design and implementation of complex ICT infrastructure systems (such as data centres, data back-up, archive and restore, basic network and communication systems, CLOUD technology, security of information systems â€“ identity management, smart cards, RFID technologies, risk management etc.)
  • Experience in at least one (1) ICT project within Home Affaires sector in the area of design and implementation of security and protection systems for complex ICT and Networking infrastructure is an advantage
  • Proven experience acquired within the last 6 calendar years in at least one (1) project related to implementation and managing of continuity of service in ICT system due to be available 24/7/365 is an advantage.
  • Experience in preparation of technical specifications for 1, preferably 2, IT supply projects.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com
